question: I was diagnosed with both Hashimoto's and Grave's Disease.  I was told that my TSH is "a little better" (I dont know the numbers).  The endo said that he wanted to repeat the TSH, T4 in 4 months.  He told me that "the thyroid is battling it out and we will need to see which side wins."  I am positive for TSI, TPO, TG.  My TSH was originally 0.02.  T3 and T4 upper end normal values.  My heart rate has not been bellow 100 in a month.  My BP is up 130/90 (higher than it was even when i was pregnant).  I am irritable and tiered all the time.  My eyes now itch in my eyelids and are dry (he said "Maybe it is allergies or conjuctivitus").  My hands are dry for the first time in my life.  I have gained about 15 lbs.  My u/s showed a 1.0 cm solid lesion that is somewhat ill-defined.  Mild thyromegaly measuring 4.8 on both sides and is heterogeneous.  He recommended me to go to the hospital and have the radiologist do a ultra-sound guided FNA biopsey ($1300 out of pocket due to deductable) for a 3-5% chance of cancer.  I was surprised he did not do the FNA himself. He has said at both appointments that he can feel a small nodule.  He offered me a beta-blocker but I have asthma and had gestational diabetes.  I am afraid of the bronchospasms and the increased risk of type 2 DM.  When I asked him if the beta blocker would help with the irritability and fatigue he said no.  I am on no medications at this time.  Should I seek a second opinion?  There are no other endo's in my town and I would need to take time off of work and travel about 2 hours.  I would like to know if there is relief or if yall think they would have the same opinion of "lets wait and see what happens."  I live in Central FL.
title: Seek a second opinion?
